Posts.Content: May 11, 2010 11:03AM leesagb wrote: I work in a lab at a Cancer Center.  The reason your labs do not draw from feet is that it is dangerous for ambulatory patients to have their feet drawn and then walk out ...there could be issues with clots etc.  That is why they do not do it. It is not that the personal are not capable.   The other issue is that the latest information out from the Breast conference says that patients CAN be drawn in their arms after a masectomy.  Our physicians allow this ...we try to draw from the side with the oldest surgery.  We go without tourniquets if possible etc.  There are still surgeons in our area that impress on their patients not to have draws from their arms..  When they do it puts us in a rough spot.  Hope this clarifies something for somene.
